articles.title: Can humanity's new giant leap into space succeed? - BBC
articles.description: Humanity is set for its next big leap into space with nations and private companies racing to build outposts on other worlds
articles.content:
There is a new order emerging in space - a race between America and China. But with the demands of space exploration, even these great superpowers won't be able to do it alone.

articles.title: NASA's Lunar Gateway space station will be so tiny that astronauts won't be able to stand - Daily Mail
articles.description: René Waclavicek, a space architect and design researcher at Austria-based LIQUIFER Space Systems, said the Lunar Gateway living quarters would total about 280 cubic feet.
articles.content:
Orbiting at 250 miles above the Earth, the International Space Station (ISS) has been integral to a bucket load of research over the past 25 years.

articles.author: HT Tech
articles.title: Asteroid Alert! Bus-sized asteroid rushing at a fiery 17221kmph towards Earth, NASA says - HT Tech
articles.description: Asteroid 2023 AH, which measures just 20-foot in size, is a potential threat to Earth, says NASA. Know why.
articles.content: NASA has detected a small yet potentially hazardous asteroid on January 11, 2023, which has been dubbed Asteroid 2023 AH and it is all set to make a very close approach towards Earth today. As per NA… [+1763 chars]
